review_title: Lots of fun, but lots to be desired
one_reviews_text:
Positive: Large community, servers generally reliable, runs ok, paintball is great fun

Negative: 

Many large updates! Latest update is 756MB to make sliders "less jittery" and other "whimsical" updates - really? I live in the country and have to download these over 5Mbps DSL - it takes 20 minutes - frequent large updates are very burdensome!

Paintball lacks any match making - Elite players are mixed in with newbies - makes for a bad first impression if a new player wants to try Paintball and gets matched to a player with over 100K hits. 

Menus do not respect basic user interface design best practices - for example, if you have a menu open on your watch at the end of a Paintball game and a new game starts, your menu is just forced closed, black RecRoom screen, then you appear in a new room. Well, you have to re-open your watch and quickly change a setting before the game starts - not at all ergonomic!

Teleporters in paintball - Some elite players use Teleporting as a way to gain a large advantage over non-teleporting players. Teleporters like that can be infuriating in a very competitive game - often one elite teleporter can join and cause many players on the server to rage quit.

review_title: Rec Room is a great VR experience.
one_reviews_text: In total, I've played this game for around 1000+ hours at this point. The Rec Room developers have put a lot of time in this game and I applaud them for making an amazing social experience, even out of VR. The in-game creation tools are easy to learn, require almost no coding/3d modeling experience at all. The rooms and worlds I see created in this game almost everyday are fun to play with your friends and family. There are small hangout rooms to relax in and fast-paced shooters that are all created by the UGC tools that Rec Room provides. Content created by the developers (RRO games) are just as good, maybe even better. There are PVP games like Paintball and Laser Tag along with PVE rooms (Quests) so you can team up with your friends to bring down goblin armies and robots all in the style of a traditional school play. Overall Rec Room is a fun experience for casual gamers and is meant to be that- a casual free-to-play experience. There is also room for competitive gamers in the form of leaderboards for PVP games and Quests, and they encourage you to be good at the game for rewarding prizes and cosmetics you can style your avatar with.

Ok, so now I've put 1,000+ hours on this game. This game is the second closest thing that we'll get to the OASIS from ready player one. Gameplay is pretty straight foward, and some people prefer to skip this game because it looks like another version of roblox, but it isn't just roblox VR, there are some rec room original games that are very popular, not just the community rooms and there aren't as many toxic kids. Anyway, this game is awesome as hell, you'll get to meet lots of people and get to hang out with them! Not to mention the community rooms are pretty epic, from running through a maze getting chased by freddy fazbear to defeating an ancient mummy inside a pyramid to hanging out in a fairy like forest with your friends, this have has a wide variety of rooms, and you can make your own as well! Though it's hard, it's worth it at the end! Now, this next part honestly depends on what you're playing on, but since you're reading this in the oculus store, then I imagine you're on oculus rift or S, this game will run decently, depending on what you're doing, it might lag or crash here and there, but overall, it runs pretty well. If you're on quest, it will run decently, you might crash while loading into a room, but since against gravity (the creators) are working hard, I imagine that they will improve the performance in the future. Graphics are fine, nothing special, but not CoD Modern Warfare 2 graphics. Now, there are microtransactions so you can get tokens (the in game currency you can use to buy clothing items), but that's totally optional, you can still get a bunch of tokens daily, and I really like that! Now, some items are insanely priced, like a pair of cat ears for 9k tokens? holy frick, but the flip side of that coin is that there are this rr original games called "quests", you can get a team of people and clear levels of enemies. If you get s, or s+ (depending on what quest you're playing), you can get the best gear that everyone wants, for free! So you don’t have to pay a penny to get the best (and most flashy) gear! Let’s talk about the community, so there’s this room called the “rec center”, which is like a hub for people to hang out in, you’ll find 3 types of rec centers, either everyone is wearing expensive and flashy gear and are playing music in the mirror room, or you’ll find kids being annoying, or just a normal rec center where everyone is chill. Sure, there are some bad apples in the community, but it’s mostly toxic free. And my only complaint of this game also applies to the community. Some mods are so sensitive, if you make a joke that even slightly criticizes them, they’ll ban you for 3 days, that’s just ridiculous. But overall, this game has its ups and downs, but I really enjoy playing it every time I get the chance!

My second issue is that the moderation system is far too easy to abuse. It's not that uncommon to see other players getting wrongfully kicked from a game or even banned. The abundance of young children ties into this, as if a group of kids decide that they don't like you or even just one gets mad at you, they can get you kicked from a game (this locks you away from that game/instance of said game), or worse, they can file a bunch of false reports against you. This will trigger an automatic ban, with no consequences for those that reported you unless you can prove that they're in the wrong, which you won't likely be able to do. I've been banned for several days at a time before because some kid got mad at me for killing him in a game. Don't let this discourage you, though! Rec Room is truly one of the best VR games out there. And it's free!

Pros:
+Regular updates with new content
+A huge variety of content.

Neutral:
=Kids. I work with kids, so sometimes I don't want to hear another obviously <13 year old in the game. Reporting system for under 13 works though. Use it people!
=Latest UI update for the watch menu is unintuitive. Usually I hate UI updates but I'll give it some time.
=Making a party is sometimes kinda wonky.

Cons:
-I think with the addition of custom rooms, the Rec Center doesn't have as many people as before, which kind of ruins the atmosphere of the game for me.
-Many people cheat at games by going into walls. This isn't usually a problem in competitive games, but I don't like it when a teammate does it in co-op.

Hey troybal, 

If you are 12 or younger and were playing Rec Room previously you were doing so against our terms of service and Code of Conduct which required players to be 13 or older. Players 12 and younger were not allowed to play Rec Room at all! This is due to USA legal regulations for online activity for people 12 or younger. 

We spent a lot of time thinking about this problem and decided to put a lot of effort and resources into creating junior profiles that meet all of the regulatory provisions for players 12 and younger. This means that rather than you not being able to play previously, or trying to play and being permanently banned by the moderation system, you are now allowed to have a Rec Room account, as long as its approved by your parent or guardian. 

We just spent a lot of time updating our expresso menu which allows players a set of basic communication options that do not require a microphone. You can access this menu using the B or Y buttons on the touch controllers. Laser Tag will also become available to everyone once it is out of the alpha. At that point juniors will be able to play as well. 

If you or your parent would like to provide more feedback about your experience with your junior profile please contact us at support@againstgrav.com  Thanks!

one_reviews_text:
Among the handful of social VR apps out there, Rec Room stands tall as perhaps the best.  Not only is it a great social hub for casual fun and nonsense, but it features a handful of surprisingly fun, well-made games to play with friends and strangers alike.  

Despite being one of VR's earliest offerings, the experience is so well-polished.  Networking is easy and seamless.  Registering an account is as simple as taking a photo at one of many "selfie booths."  Making friends is as easy as giving someone a virtual handshake, and joining a party happens by giving someone a fist bump.  Transitioning from social hubs, to game arenas and back again, is a matter of looking at your virtual wristwatch, and selecting a room from there.

With Rec Room, everything just works, and it works intuitively.  It's fun, free, cross-platform, polished, and always populated.  That's why to me, Rec Room is an essential app that'll be a staple in the VR world for years to come.
